intro: Hoya somadeeae, commonly known as the Somadeeae hoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Hoya somadeeae prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements make it a favored ornamental plant among horticulturists.
